fit.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: if a piece of clothing fits you, it is the right size for your body
fit.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: His clothes did not fit him very well.
The jacket’s fine, but the trousers don’t fit.
I know this dress is going to fit you like a glove (=fit you very well).
fit.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to try a piece of clothing on someone to see if it is the right size for them, or to make sure a special piece of equipment is right for them
fit.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: I’m being fitted for a new suit tomorrow.
He may need to be fitted with a hearing aid.
fit.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: if something fits in a place, it is the right size or shape to go there
fit.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: I couldn’t find a key which fitted the lock.
Most cookers are designed to fit level with your worktops.
The plastic cover fits neatly over the frame.
fit.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: to put something carefully into a place that is the right size or shape for it
fit.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: She fitted the last piece into the jigsaw puzzle.
fit.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: if something fits into a place, there is enough space for it
fit.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: I wanted to put the wardrobe behind the door, but I don’t think it’ll fit.
You might be able to fit some small flowering plants between the larger bushes.
I don’t think we’ll be able to fit any more people into the car.
We should be able to fit one more in.
fit.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: to put a piece of equipment into a place, or a new part onto a machine, so that it is ready to be used
fit.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: I need to fit a lock on the door.
Anti-theft devices are fitted to all our cars.
The windows are all fitted with security locks.
fit.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: if something fits another thing, it is similar to it or suitable for it
fit.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: The punishment should fit the crime.
Police said the car fits the description of the stolen vehicle.
Scientists often select facts to fit their theories.
He didn’t fit the conventional image of a banker.
The rhythm should fit with the meaning of a poem.
fit.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: someone who is fit is strong and healthy, especially because they exercise regularly
fit.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: You must be very fit if you do so much running.
He was young, good-looking, and physically fit.
I swim twice a week to try and keep fit.
She’s over eighty now, but still as fit as a fiddle (=very fit).
I had just come back from holiday and was fighting fit.
He may not be fit for Saturday’s match.
I don’t know if I’ll be fit enough to take part in the race.
Psychiatrists said he was fit to stand trial  (=he was mentally healthy enough).
fit.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: suitable or good enough for something
fit.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: We made sure the land was fit for drilling.
The food was not fit for human consumption.
This book is not fit for publication!
He is not fit to govern this country!
This room is not fit to be seen!
fit.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: a time when you feel an emotion very strongly and cannot control your behaviour
fit.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: She killed him in a fit of temper.
He quit his job in a fit of drunken depression.
fit.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: a short period of time when someone loses consciousness and cannot control their body because their brain is not working properly
fit.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: She used to have fits as a baby.
people who suffer from epileptic fits
fit.translation[2].definitions[2].defini: a short time during which you laugh or cough a lot in a way that you cannot control
fit.translation[2].definitions[2].exampl: He had a violent coughing fit.
We were all in fits of laughter trying to clear up the mess.
Carl had us all in fits (=made us laugh a lot) with his stories.
The girls collapsed into a fit of the giggles.
fit.translation[2].definitions[3].defini: the way in which something fits on your body or fits into a space
fit.translation[2].definitions[3].exampl: The dress was a perfect fit.
I managed to get everything into the suitcase, but it was a tight fit.
fit.translation[2].definitions[4].defini: if there is a fit between two things, they are similar to each other or are suitable for each other
fit.translation[2].definitions[4].exampl: We must be sure that there’s a fit between the needs of the children and the education they receive.
fit.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: to have a seizure (=a sudden condition in which someone cannot control the movements of their body)
fit.translation[4].definitions[0].defini: to put a piece of equipment into place, or a new part on a machine
fit.translation[4].definitions[0].exampl: Interactive entertainment systems have been fitted on all the airline’s 747s.
Anti-theft devices are fitted to all our cars.
Insurance is cheaper for homes fitted with alarms.
fit.translation[5].definitions[0].defini: if there is a fit between a company’s different activities, they go well together and can be managed together profitably
fit.translation[5].definitions[0].exampl: The fit between the two merged supermarket chains is excellent.
